resolution:
1. Restart your router by unplugging it for 30 seconds
2. Forget the WiFi network on your device
3. Reconnect by entering the password again
4. If issue persists, check if other devices can connect

1. Run a speed test to confirm slow speeds
2. Restart your router
3. Check for bandwidth-heavy applications
4. Move closer to the router or use ethernet cable

1. Check if power adapter LED is on
2. Inspect charging cable for damage
3. Try a different power outlet
4. Remove battery and reconnect (if removable)
5. Contact IT if issue persists

1. Check if keyboard is properly connected
2. Try different USB port
3. Restart your computer
4. Update keyboard drivers
5. Test with external keyboard

1. Close and restart the application
2. Clear application cache and temporary files
3. Check for software updates
4. Reinstall the application
5. Check system requirements

1. Check if you have admin rights
2. Verify system requirements
3. Disable antivirus temporarily
4. Clear Windows Update cache
5. Contact IT for installation assistance

1. Use 'Forgot Password' link on login page
2. Check email for reset link
3. Contact IT helpdesk for manual reset
4. Verify your identity with security questions

1. Wait 30 minutes for automatic unlock
2. Contact IT helpdesk for immediate unlock
3. Verify you're using correct credentials
4. Check if account needs reactivation

1. Check if printer is powered on
2. Verify printer connection (USB/Network)
3. Clear print queue
4. Restart print spooler service
5. Reinstall printer drivers
